abstract: As investors rely increasingly on Finra’s database to vet Wall Street professionals, some brokers and executives are trying to remove complaints.
snippet: As investors rely increasingly on Finra’s database to vet Wall Street professionals, some brokers and executives are trying to remove complaints.
lead_paragraph: If an investor checked the securities industry’s official regulatory database of complaints against brokers for the name of Michele Kief, a Wells Fargo broker in Naples, Fla., it would reveal nine client disputes — enough red flags to give a customer pause.

headline.main: A Rise in Requests From Brokers to Wipe the Slate Clean
headline.print_headline: A Rise in Broker Requests to Wipe the Slate Clean
